result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
12:57 PM Defendant Matthew A Loy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Matthew A Loy.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the history of the case. Attorney Meyer-O'Day states that he has filed a brief but would be ready to argue today. Attorney Harper asks for a time and date for an oral argument.
Oral arguments scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Oral arguments on November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
9:04 AM Defendant Freddie R. Kelly Jr. in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day appeared by phone for Freddie R. Kelly Jr.  Attorney Meyer-O'Day speaks about a briefing that was requested in the prior hearing. Attorney Forehand reads the information. Attorney Meyer-O'Day waives the formal  reading and enters a NG plea on all counts. Court advises the court reporter to prepare the transcript at the county expense. Court will work on a briefing schedule.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:36 PM Defendant Matthew A Loy in court in custody.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Matthew A Loy.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. State indicates that they want to present all the motions but would come back at a later date for a decision. Officer Gerber sworn and testimony given. State begins examination. 
Cross examination begins at 4:11 PM by Attorney McDougal. 
4:29 PM Attorney Harper re-directs. 

04:30: State asks for a bind over and explains why. Attorney McDougal doesn't have any argument about bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds over.

Court speaks about the suppression and parties will submit documents.

Attorney McDougal hasn't received the body cam yet. Attorney McDougal would like to file a brief. State asks that this be set out for 30 day for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Arraignment on June 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on April 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:48 PM Defendant Matthew A Loy in court; in custody.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Matthew A Loy.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal states that she will be bring a motion to suppress and asks that the motion and preliminary hearing be done at the same time. Defendant waives the time limits of the preliminary hearing. Court sets aside an hour for a preliminary hearing and motion to suppress. Court set a deadline for the motion hearing to be filed by April 26, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:38 AM Defendant Matthew A Loy in court.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Matthew A Loy.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal asks for a preliminary hearing to be scheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney McDougal waives the formal reading and asks for a preliminary hearing date. Max penalties stated. Attorney McDougal waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:21 PM Defendant Matthew A Loy appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal appear by video. Attorney McDougal just was put  on this case today and hasn't been able to speak with ML.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:05 PM Defendant Matthew A Loy appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. ML doesn't have an attorney. Max penalties stated. ML hasn't received the complaint. Court sets this over.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Appearances: Judge Sharp, SKK Court Reporter, DA Harper for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail

State request a $6,000 cash bond with no drink provisions. 

Defendant isn't able to post and amount of cash.

Court orders $6,000 cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

March 21, 2022 at 1 PM

Court authorizes a CC to appoint an attorney if needed.
